title: Finally, A Protein Meal Replacement Shake I Can Feel Good About!
body: Well, I like to use protein, meal replacement shakes to help supplement my eating. I always have to be mindful of my weight because of genetics and also age (I'm 46, and the weight doesn't come off as easy as it used to). Anyway, I am currently going to the gym 5-6 days a week and am eating a clean diet. I have had a lot of issues with GERD, so I have had to adopt a diet to ensure that no foods or drinks trigger my condition. I also have issues with bladder irritation here and there. When looking for a shake like this, I wanted a shake that was plant protein based and also was healthy...low sugars, probiotics, vitamins, minerals, etc. I have tried Slim Fast, Herbalife, Vemma Bode, GNC Total Lean 25 and always questioned what I was really putting into my body. Most of these shakes tasted like a guilty-pleasure, very sweet but left an after taste. To be truthful, I only lost weight on one...SlimFast. I gained weight with GNC Total Lean 25 and was even watching what I ate and was exercising at the time. Anyway, I did a lot of research on shakes and found that the majority of the people liked Shakeology because of its healthy ingredients. I took a look at the price and had sticker-shock! After doing more research, I found Nature's Bounty Protein Shake Mix. I read that it was very comparable to Shakeology and that it also had helped someone with their GERD issues. I just ordered this flavor and the vanilla for a one-time order to try it out. The canisters are smaller than that of its competitors; however, you can't beat the price and the quality of the product. I know that this review may be premature as I have only had three shakes, since receiving the shipment yesterday morning. However, I have to say that I am already loving this product! I mix it with almond milk and also add some berries, but I have also had the shake without fruit. It tastes great, and there is no chemical after taste. It isn't too sweet either. I have a NutriBullet RX and mix everything in there. Shake comes out great! But that is not what I am so impressed about...I have also been feeling under the weather the past few days. After drinking the shakes, I am actually feeling better and have energy. My stomach is good with regard to the GERD...no complaints there, except for being a little gassy, but this happens when I first start on a product like this until my system adjusts. I just feel better, and it has only been a couple of days. I look forward to seeing if I lose weight with the shake. I am also adding it to my 21 Day Fix Program instead of using Shakeology. So far, I think this product is great! I am not hungry, I feel great, the quality is there and the price is right! I will update this review as I notice any additional benefits or negatives with the product. So far, I recommend it!

title: Hunger-Curbing Protein Shake
body:
When I first went looking for a protein drink, my main goal was to find a protein powder that was filling, tasted good, and also provided a bit of nutrition. I did quite a bit of research - comparing Slim Fast, ViSalus, and Premier Protein among others. One of my colleagues was nice enough to let me try one of her chocolate Premier protein shakes. After trying it (it had 30 grams of protein - tasted pretty good) I was still hungry after a couple of hours, which was disappointing to me, considering how much protein was in the shake. When I ran across this shake, I was intrigued that it had not only protein, but vitamins and digestive enzymes as well. I was definitely hooked, also when I saw the various reviews stating how delicious and filling the shakes were. I decided to take a chance on these shakes and ordered the decadent chocolate.

A week and a half later, I have been consistently replacing one to two meals a day with two scoops of the protein powder, mixed with two tablespoons of PB2 powdered peanut butter and 8oz - 12 oz unsweetened vanilla almond milk. I mix this together in a blender bottle and it tastes just like a more liquidy peanut butter chocolate milkshake. Mixing the almond milk, PB2, and protein powder, I stay consistently full at work from breakfast until lunch hour - around 4 hours without any hunger pains.

I highly recommend purchasing this shake. I just recently purchased my second container of this powder a couple days ago. Due to the addition of the digestive enzymes and the vitamins, I store the powder in the refrigerator, along with the almond milk. It doesn't say anywhere on the container that you need to do that, but I do it anyway as an added precaution. Also: the powder does come with a scoop in the container. I had to literally dig around in the container to find it, as the powder had buried it, but I eventually found it. If you order this powder, you will not be disappointed. It's definitely a protein powder, but it doesn't taste like one - it is very palatable. You can't go wrong.

title: Delicious Protein Mix for Meal Replacement Shakes
body:
This stuff smells like sweet vanilla powdered pound cake...
and that's basically what it tastes like as well.
It makes a very tasty shake.
We start with sweet vanilla almond milk as a base,
though you could certainly use cow's milk if you prefer.
(Don't use water... that's just lame, and it produces a low quality result).
Then, we add this powder which provides protein, sweetness, and bulk.
And here's the big secret: we then add FROZEN bananas and berries.
Don't add fresh bananas / fruit because that gives the shake a more
thin and juice-like consistency. If you use frozen bananas, it thickens
the shake so much that you truly do not need to add any ice at all.
The frozen bananas also do not melt rapidly like crushed ice does.
Using frozen bananas or other frozen fruits is almost like adding ice cream
to the mix... making it very thick and sweet.
These shakes, when prepared as described above, are great for a
meal replacement to keep weight under control. They are very filling.

We also tried the chocolate version, to which we add chocolate almond milk,
and frozen bananas (but no other fruit), and that makes a nice change of pace,
and a tasty shake as well. However, the vanilla is a more versatile base to which
a wider variety of frozen fruits can be added.

I used 8 ounces of Silk Light Chocolate Milk (to keep the calories down, but when I ran out I COULD drink it with 2% milk, but it was really nasty in comparison) and one scoop of the mix. As mentioned, I wanted to use this to give me a low-calorie meal so I could lose weight. My first year of teaching, I gained something like 20 pounds, and over the summer, I wanted to get rid of that weight. My dad was sure that protein supplements were used by people who wanted to GAIN weight, and I was nervous, but I had read some positive reviews about others who had had success. title: Excellent, but typical in some ways.
body:
I'm not a breakfast person but I'm trying to lose weight and need a morning kickstart and nutrients for my day. This is definitely low cal enough. It for sure has all the vitamins needed and more. The typical is mainly the flavor and sweetness. I'm looking for something that doesn't feel substantial in the morning and even in water (rather than suggested milk) feels heavy... it's typical of shakes... it's fine. Also it is very sweet rather than subtly sweet. I'd love a company to flavor their shakes based on flavor rather than sugar (sweetener) count! I always feel like they are trying to cover up a not great flavor by making it so sweet. But again, that's typical and every company out there seems to do one or the other - super nutrients (and taste meh) or good flavor (and not quite perfect in the nutrients) rather than both.

Ultimately I'll buy this again!

title: Tastes good in milk, not water.
body:
This stuff is great, I purchased it to drink instead of eating breakfast, It is recommended that you get 30 grams of protein in the morning if you are looking to lose weight. After having 4 kids and 6 additional pregnancies that I sadly miscarried, it has gotten a bit harder to lose weight than it used to be. I wanted a protein shake that tasted decent and had enough protein to make a difference, wasn't loaded with calories, and didn't contain too many chemicals or fake sugars.

Can't yet say it has helped me lose weight, I have 20 lbs to lose and so far after having been on it for 3 days, have gotten down 2 lbs, But can't exactly say the shake caused the loss though since it has only been 3 days and I have also been eating salad for lunch and a low calorie dinner. Before this I lost 5 lbs just eating salad for breakfast and lunch and a low calorie dinner. That was in 5 days.

As for the taste, In 8 ounces of milk (which brings the grams of protein up to 23), It is DELICIOUS! I mean really really good, you can't taste the stevia, It tastes like a milk shake. Really, really good!
In water, it is disgusting! You can totally taste the stevia, it leaves a nasty aftertaste, and just is hard going down.
If you add the cup of whole milk to it, you are still only getting 270 calories for breakfast which is a lot better than most breakfasts. When I can get to the store again, I am going to purchase some skim and see how it tastes with skim. I'll update when i've tried it that way.

I love the amount of vitamins, amino acids , probiotics, and even biotin that are in here. I feel good about drinking this not only to aid in my weight loss, but just for overall health.

If you are pregnant, and looking for a nutritional shake, this would not be for you, it contains Bromelain (from pineapple), which can cause contractions, It also contains Papain from Papaya, which is not known to be safe during pregnancy.
The only reason this go t 4 stars instead of 5 is because it is gross in water.
Will update in a week or so with any weight loss info.

Update: This is just as good in skim milk as it is in whole milk and I will be buying this brand again.

title: So far so good -- a first review.
body:
The price of Orgain, my favorite health drink, went through the roof. I looked around for a moderately priced replacement and found Nature' Bounty Vanilla. I examined the ingredients carefully and it all looked good.(Proprietary Protein Blend: Pea Protein Isolate, Whey Protein Concentrate, Rice Protein Concentrate, Fructose, Inulin, Natural Flavors, Maltodextrin, Tricalcium Phosphate, Xanthan Gum, Soy Lecithin, Contains milk and soy ingredients.) Additionally, only 6 grams of sugar per serving-- some of the health drinks have as much as 22 grams of sugar, too much, in my opinion.

This drink tastes like what it is -- a health food; that is, it won't be confused with a soda fountain vanilla milkshake. Even so, I found it pleasant when mixed with eight ounces of one per cent milk. I put the two tablespoons of the protein powder in milk and then used a soda fountain style mixer to blend the ingredients. After a couple of minutes I poured the mix into a glass. The powder was completely disolved and the drink did look like a soda fountain shake, but as mentioned, tasted like a light vanilla health food beverage. When I added two tablespoons of Carnation Malted Milk to the mix, the flavor improved dramatically. Even so, it still tastes like what it is -- health food.

I will let the nutrition experts comment on the true value of this product for our health and well being. I'll come back to this review after I have finished the entire contents of the 16 ounce container and update Amazon readers about any perceived health benefits from this product.

Update: I continue to use this protein shake and find it filling and satisfying. I now add coffee milk to the mix and the flavor has improved dramatically.

Update 2: I tried the chocolate flavor and like it better than the vanila. It has a cocoa taste and is not too sweet. I then added a tablespoon of Carnation Malted Milk to the second shake I made and liked the results very much. It seems like this is a nutritious drink, but I am open to comments from people who know more than I do. Thanks.

body:

The problem is the price here. I've bought it for $9 to $11 here on Amazon and that's a fair price but $15 to $23, which I've seen it recently, is way too much. It only has 15grams of protein in it per 2 scoops, which is pretty low. Most other protein powders have 25 to 30g of protein per serving. Also the container is super tiny. I think it only has 11 or 12 servings in it if you're careful. I love it but I'm not paying more than $11 for it.

I've ordered something else for now that was on sale. Something that has the normal 30grams of protein so I could even divide that in half making it last twice as long and get the same as in this.

title: I have heard this is a good dupe for Shakeology
body:
I purchased this since I am now going to the gym and need protein boost to help aid in toning. Also, I am hoping to drop a few pounds so I plan to use as a meal replacement (likely breakfast) and I may also use as a post workout shake for some gym days as needed. I have only used this for a few days now so I cannot yet comment on it's assistance in my weight loss. However, I can provide information on toleration and taste.

I purchased on Amazon for about $15 which is a decent price for the ingredients. I have heard this is a good dupe for Shakeology. It really has an impressive vitamin content in the mix which is great because I am also working to grow my hair out so Im really hoping this will be an great addition to my current vitamin regimen which now consists of a basic multi-vitamin and an iron pill that is advised by my doctor.

How I mix: So far I have been mixing 2 scoops of the Chocolate protein mix with water to keep down calories but will soon try with Almond milk. I use 2 scoops of protein, a half banana, a tbsp of PB2 and tsp of virgin coconut oil, a few cubes and sometimes a tsp of cocoa powder and voila! It's a decent tasting shake. It can be a bit chalky but I'm sure that will be better once I try it with almond milk.So far it actually seems to be aiding my digestion and I haven't experience any negative affects to it which is a surprise because I experienced some issues with GNC proteins I've used in the past.

I think this is a pretty good protein shake for the price.

UPDATE: I have used this powder about 4 to 5 days per week as a breakfast replacement for 3 weeks now and I'm really shocked but I believe this is really helping me. I haven't weighed but I have been getting compliments on looking slimmer. I myself have noticed I'm looking quite a bit more toned especially in the belly area, I'm not sure if this is due to the probiotics in the products controlling bloat. I haven't changed anything else in my diet as a whole whatsoever but I am working out which I was also doing prior to purchasing this product. I do notice that I am not feeling as hungry at times throughout the day. Not much difference but I think overall I am eating a bit less.

On the negative side I am noticing a bit of breakout on my skin that started right around the time I began taking this powder but I can't verify this is related. I will continue to use this product and will likely be ordering this again soon!

title: Great Before the Price Change
body:
First of all, this is a good product. I usually have a shake with 2 scoops of chocolate and 8-10 ounces of Almond/Cashew Milk Blend. I normally drink this shake in sips during my workout, from about 6:30 am until 7:30 am. I then eat breakfast around 8, consuming a little bit of fruit and water. This sets me up to be ready to eat around 11:30, which is decent, considering that I will usually have taken in 0 net calories for the day by lunch. I have only tried the Chocolate flavor, and I must say, I was amazed by how good it tasted: this is my first time trying protein shakes and I was pleasantly surprised. I have tried it with water, skim milk, vanilla soy milk, almond milk, and unsweetened Almond/Cashew Milk (it's been a wild ride). Water will do, but it must be very cold or else the shake isn't very enjoyable at all. Skim milk definitely tastes the best, but I have a sensitivity to lactose, and the delicious taste of the shake is not worth the discomfort later. Vanilla soy milk has been quite sweet, but I've never been a fan of soy milk, and that carries over into it in shakes. However, I would assume that people who like soy milk plain would enjoy it in shakes more than I do. Almond milk tastes good, the kind I used was very lightly sweetened and it was fairly enjoyable to drink. The mix of unsweetened Almond and Cashew Milk (Blue Diamond Brand) has been my favorite so far: it's quite creamy, thanks to the cashews; the milk only has 25 calories per serving, which is second only to water; and it sits with me much better than the skim milk.

Now, here comes the bad part: I have been using this for about 2 weeks, and when I first bought it, I paid less than $9 (with the $1 coupon and the lower price). Now, the price has gone up and I'm not sure that I'll continue using it.

title: Pretty good protein shake!
body:
This is the first time I've tried a product like this, so I'm afraid I can't compare it to others. However, I was expecting something pretty awful, something I'd have to force down. Surprisingly, this stuff actually tastes pretty good. I mix up a serving of this after my workout to help speed up my recovery. It seems to work, and I'm not feeling sore for as long after a hard workout.

But how's it taste? Depends on what you mix it in. If I need the extra calories, I'll mix it in a glass of almond milk. It tastes best that way, like chocolate milk! I can drink it in water as well; but I tend to use about 6 ounces of water instead of 8. It tastes too watered down with 8 ounces.

I'll admit, I'm too lazy to bring out my blender for a tiny protein shake, so I just blend it by hand. A whisk works fairly well. The easiest way is to put your water/milk into a water bottle, add the powder and shake the bottle. Shaking it really breaks up the clumps!

In the end, it's still a bit powdery, but it doesn't bother me. I always follow it with a drink of something else, because it tends to leave an odd taste behind.

As a warning: If you aren't used to taking something like this, you might want to start out slowly. This stuff can tear your stomach up. Perhaps start with half a serving daily and work your way up. Your system needs some time to get used to it.

title: Protein for the Non-Athlete
body: This is delicious. The chocolate flavor is light yet rich. The texture when mixed with a liquid is similar to that of a smoothie or chocolate milk-not too think and not too watery. I put a little less than the serving suggestion of liquid to retain some thickness. Rather than water I prefer unsweetened coconut milk. The protein powder is sweet as is and does not need any added sweetness. Sometimes I add a couple strawberries or a little yogurt just for fun, because it tastes wonderful on its own. My experience regarding appetite suppressant ability was a hit and miss. Sometimes it kept me full for up to 6 hours, and other times it appeared not to do much of anything for my appetite, and I would eat a small meal shortly after. In conclusion, to achieve more of a full sensation, add at least 8 oz of liquid or more. This shake can be hand mixed or blended. It will look chunkier if you mix it by hand, but the texture will be smooth when you drink it. I am very satisfied with this product because it gives me an option to reduce my calorie intake and avoid constant snacking in the evening. Used consistently, for one or two meals a day you will flatten your stomach and lose weight.

title: Starbucks hacks below
body: If you dont end up liking the flavor of the vanilla it is very difficult to mask with other stronger flavors. That being said, I work at starbucks and I have taken my blended beverage knowledge and played around with this powder a bit. If you add coffee and a flavor to this the powder will act like frappuccino base but without sugar. It is perfect if you do 1 cup ice, 1/2 cup milk (I use almond milk) and 1/2 cup cold brew coffee or 1 cup of milk and 1-2 shots of espresso, 1 tsp vanilla or almond extract or 2-3 pumps of flavor (you can buy the bottles of syrup from Starbucks, including the sugar free ones, if you like them and they are about $12 and last for a month once opened) and 2 scoops of the powder and blend. Or if your not worried about calories, you can buy a tall vanilla cream cold brew with no ice and blend it at home with 1 cup of ice and one serving of this protein powder and it fantastic. Like life changing fantastic.

title: Fine product, but 18% sugar unneeded
body: This is a very good powdered multi vitamin with other nutrients. I like it; I'm ordering it a second time. But it's 18% sugar (6 grams sugar per 33 grams serving). That's unneeded. I think a lot of people like me would prefer no sugar added. There was a powdered multivitamin called RDA that is no longer made. It had no sugar added. It was made by a small company, Lewis Labs, whose marketing was not good, and which discontinued the item. I believe Nature's Bounty is trying to compete on this item with GNC, which has very sweet powdered vitamins with caffeine--which this product does not have. Maybe, in addition to the Vanilla and chocolate flavors, Nature's Bounty could offer a no-sugar-added version of the same product, and test whether it sells over perhaps 6-9 months. Chobani's has recently offered fruit yogurts with very reduced sugars, about a third of the regular amount. There's a market for it!

title: Not that good with water, but great with almond milk
body: First, let me just say that I do not care for protein shakes but thought I'd try this one because I simply do get enough protein in one day, and the majority of the product reviews are good. I made the first shake as directed with water; and, to me, it was rather yucky. Yet, I thought it had potential, so I added a tablespoon of heavy cream to make it more palatable. That worked but still not good enough to say yum. My second drink was made with very cold, unsweetened Almond "Beverage" (the one Trader Joe's sells), and it was really good -- yum! I used the BlenderBottle shaker to mix just the powder and the milk, and it was great! What a difference the almond milk makes. I actually look forward to my daily shake and agree with other reviewers that it is not too chocolatey and not overly sweet. For me, it is just right!

title: Taste is good. Doesn���t keep me full
body:
Good enough taste and awesome value for your money.

I just can���t say this keeps me full. I have always still been hungry after drinking a protein drink. I had higher hopes for this product.

I am a taller girl and have a bit more of a speedy metabolism, so maybe that���s why. But I tried this a couple times with banana and some milk in a smoothie and still wanted to eat about an hour or less afterward.

Not a good protein drink for supplementing meals or hunger.

If you want to lose weight then I think this will work but make sure you have a healthy snack in between. So you don���t feel like your starving.

Can���t attest to any weight loss yet because I didn���t use it enough. I will try to update my review later.

title: Tasted good
body: I like that it tastes almost like chocolate milk.

title: Tastes better than I expected and was well sealed
body:
The taste is a bit bland but it could be because it's dark chocolate so less sugar. It can be difficult to blend. However, I just mix it first in a little bit of warm/hot water then add milk and water.
Tastes pretty good for having all the vitamins and amino acids. But does have a slight "bland" taste but, not as noticeable as some other protein shakes.
Stevia is a great natural cane sugar substitute but I personally think it has a slight bitter after taste and prefer erythritol. But my brother loves Stevie and doesn't notice the bitter after taste.

The package is a bit smaller than I expected..

title: Best tasting powder I've tried!
body:
I use protein powder to supplement my diet because I do not meet my daily protein recommendation otherwise. I have tried a couple other protein powders since I used this one. This one by far is my favorite!! It tastes amazing compared to the other powders!! Of course, it still has that "protein powder" taste, but it is enjoyable. I have been trying others to see what else is out there and getting some with higher protein levels. One, I am to the point of choking them down because they taste so bad. And two, they seem to make my stomach hurt afterwards.
Natures bounty also has a lot fewer calories than the other ones I've tried which is nice if you aren't using it to replace food necessarily.
The only negative I have is that I expected the "vitamin" part of the powder to replace my daily multivitamin, but after looking at it, it doesn't even come close.
All that being said, I am thinking I will switch back to it for the taste alone!

title: Great stuff
body: Tastes great for what it is, I���m not too big on my protein shakes tasting incredible or anything, just need it to do the job without making me gag lol I read a lot of complaints about it not being filled to the top and I gotta say people aren���t paying attention to the fact that this is the weight it���s advertised as being.You���re not being cheated, they leave space for air to keep the product fresh that���s all. The price is really amazing and I���ve bought this quite a few times to help with my anemia issues and it definitely helps in conjunction with my other vitamins. Not particularly filling but again, for the price it���s worth it. Totally recommend.

title: Tastes like cardboard, but I feel great!
body:
I just got this today. Made it exactly as described on the container. The bad news: it tastes like sawdust mixed with chocolate. The good news: an hour later, after I had sworn never to drink this again, I was feeling FABULOUS. I'm not talking just OK, I mean, GREAT. Energized, satisfied, full, not at all hyper like on a caffeine laden product, just good, like after a great workout.
So I've decided that I can suck it up and swallow this down to feel this good. It cost $20 for 13 servings, which is OK. Right there with the other protein powders. I think the nutrition in this is better. It has flaxseed, collagen, all the amino acids, fiber, all your basic vitamins and most at 100%, and all without artificial sweeteners and only 110 calories and 5 net carbs.
Hope this helps someone else trying to decide.

title: Great for Smoothies!
body: I wanted some protein to add into my breakfast smoothies and this was perfect. The taste is good. My only complaint it that the tub was only like 3/4 full. Not sure why but I didn't feel like I got a true full tub.

title: Well���.
body: Not going to lie it will give you gas but I like all the extra vitamins all in one drink. Flavor is awful with water. Better with almond milk. No lactose issues for me either and I still get gas with only the recommended 2 scoops.

title: Great taste, but a little pricey.
body: This stuff is pretty good. I used "All the Whey" brand back in the day and this stuff tastes just as good, but a little thicker. Almost like a really thick milkshake. I mix 16oz of unsweetened coconut milk with this and drink it for breakfast on my way to work. It tastes almost like semi-sweet dark chocolate, which I love. I also tried mixing in a little Splenda one morning to sweeten it up a bit and it tasted more like a Hershey bar. Either way is fine by me. Some people might have a problem with the consistency. It is a protein shake after all and that is a common complaint. But it's the best tasting protein shake that I've had in a long time. My only complaint is that it's a little pricey compared to some other brands that sell twice as much for a few dollars more. Of course, they don't taste as good.

title: Seriously, tastes great, no lie!
body: I don't know what the "not like" fuss is about. It's delicious! I just made my first smoothie - very simple. 1/2 cup almond milk, 1 1/2 teaspoons almond butter, 2 scoops powder, 1/2 frozen banana, 1/3 cup frozen black berries. I have a simple Oster blender. I am enjoying this very much! And, i adapted the recipe from a book called Zero Belly Smooties. They said to use 1/2 cup of protein powder, but I used two scoops as recommended by the manufacturer. Note: this is my very FIRST protein shake. I don't even taste the powder, and no bad after taste in my opinion. I am 52, pretty slender - just want to lose 5 or 10 lbs and eat healthier. I know that taste is a matter of opinion. For not ever having a protein shake in my life, I really like this!!

title: Vanilla flavor is great!
body: I ordered this after doing a lot of research. I ordered the chocolate but got vanilla instead but decided to just keep it and not return it. I think the vanilla flavor is really great! I drink it every day for breakfast. I use half a frozen banana, 4 oz of water, 4 oz of non-dairy milk (I use oat or almond), three ice cubes, and two scoops of the powder. The only thing is that the powder can tend to clump up, so make sure to give it a good shake before you blend it. I found that helps the powder issue.

title: My taste buds did a little dance!
body: I'm on day 6 and have already decided to subscribe to this powder monthly! The taste is amazing and like most, I'm using the shake as a meal replacement for breakfast. For the first two days I only added water and I was surprisingly satisfied. I decided to add unsweetened almond milk on day 3 and found I was able to go a little longer before getting lunch. This is such an easy product to drink; no chalky taste, no aftertaste and I actually look forward to drinking it in the mornings! I've also chugging drinking my morning coffee while at work. The energy this product gives me feels very natural. I'm looking to start using it as meal replacement for dinner, also!

title: Tastes great for a vitamin-packed protein shake!
body:
No complaints on the taste--even my kids approved a small taste of it (they wanted more than a small taste!). Barely any chalky aftertaste, too. As for any health benefits, I've yet to see anything amazing, but I didn't buy it for that purpose anyhow. I bought for a quick, healthy breakfast, since I barely have time to sit down and eat a "real" breakfast in the morning. With these shakes, I can make one, and drink as I'm on the go. I bought a "Blender Bottle" to make these, and it's nothing short of amazing!

The only con for me about the shake mix is that it's made with soy, which I try to avoid. For that reason, I won't buy this again. My mistake in not paying closer attention to detail of the ingredients. That said, for those who do consume soy products, I highly recommend this product, as it tastes great.

title: Best chocolate tasting protein mix!
body: I've tried many chocolate flavored protein mixes over the last 6 months, and this one is my favorite chocolate flavored one. I mix it in the Magic Bullet every morning before I head to the gym at 5AM! It takes like a chocolate milkshake, and best if really really cold. Doesn't mix as well with a spoon, and can be a little chalky unless you use a smoothie mixer/blender. I use 3-4 ice cubes, 2 scoops of this mix (the scoop is small), add about 10-12 oz. of unsweetened almond milk. It's really very chocolatety tasting and I love it! It does give me a little burst of energy about a half hour later that lasts a few hours. Satisfied feeling for a couple of hours before feeling hungry. I just re-ordered my 2nd container and hope to start having some results from the collagen that's in this! I'll update my review at a later date to advise of the benefits of extended use...

title: Hard to dissolve.
body: The only thing I didn't like is how hard it is to dissolve completely; even in a cup of hot coffee. Otherwise I like the vanilla bean flavor in my coffee.

title: Not bad
body: Tried but the test weird.

title: Best tasting chocolate protein powder I've had!
body:
Love this protein powder, I usually get stomach aches with other protein mixes/drinks I have tried but this never gives me a problem. It has a rich chocolate taste and it's DELICIOUS with unsweetened vanilla almond milk... plus a great addition to a chocolate banana smoothie!

For the price, you really cannot beat this.

SADLY, they sent me the vanilla bean by accident when I ordered last week. The vanilla bean is OK! Had to return it, the chocolate is too good to pass up.

title: Standard Protein Powder
body: This product I bought for someone. They regularly use this product as meal replacement. It does what it says it does.

title: Strong flavor
body: It's a really strong taste more of a creamy flavor, so far I like the vanilla one I do only 1 1/2 scoop with almond milk and ice. If I put 2 scoops I let the ice melt a bit so the flavor is not so strong. I have also tried the chocolate one and its the same thing, strong taste. I'm not much of a sweet person so 4 stars on this. I have to shake this alot of times so I can make sure it doesn't leave small clumps of powder. I drink this in the am with 2 boiled eggs and a fruit, but I'm not a breakfast person.

title: Not Grainy
body: This is my first time trying out a protein powder and I like this one a lot.I was not expecting it to be vanilla bean, but it is still good. The size was smaller then expected, but I think it is till a good size for the price. I've been mixing this with my vanilla yogurt, milk, and then depending on what other flavors I'm in the mood for I'll do peanut butter and banana, mixed berries, or ,what I really like, peaches and mango's. I'll will definitely be buying this again and probably get the chocolate flavor to go with my peanut butter and banana smoothies.

title: Good!
body: This protein shake is actually very good. I ordered the chocolate and usually mix it with a little peanut butter and some almond milk. Every now and then I'll throw in a banana, or coconut (think mounds shake!). At first try this shake is very powder-y. However, if you mix it in a blender for about 30 secs and add more than just water to it, it is very good. What drew me to it was all the vitamins and probiotics. It does not taste like swallowing a vitamin. And the chocolate is pretty rich. If you prefer to drink shakes for b-fast then give this one a try. I'm not a body builder or gym rat. I am just a mom who prefers something quick in the morning and full of nutrients. I am very health conscience and maintain a healthy diet and exercise 5 days a week. This protein mix is a great price as well. That's always a plus! :)

title: Good and great price
body: I bought this in order to help regulate my digestive system and to help make sure I'm getting all the extra I don't get when I slack on eating right. I'm also nursing so I wanted something I knew was safe for that and would help my daughter too. I really like this product and the price is unbeatable! Although I'm not overly thrilled with the chocolate taste.. But I definitely think it tastes better than Shakoligy! It lasted me a little over two weeks rather than the 30 days it states. And that was me using it every morning with the dosage it states to use. I will probably look around for differ t ones and compare as far as price and flavor goes. But it is for sure worth giving a try.

title: Pretty good
body: I've used the chocolate and the vanilla, and I'm not an athlete or a body builder, I'm just a regular person who likes food to taste good. So here's what I think: as far as protein powder goes, these are both pretty great. Price, flavor and texture are most important to me and these are good. I've blended these a couple of different ways, including following the directions that say to blend with water. Blended with water they are kind of "meh" as a lot of protein drinks kind of are, but blended with milk and fruit is very tasty and texturally pleasing. That's how I do it most of the time. I will purchase again.

title: Needs something more to be truly filling
body:
Needs something more to be truly filling--definitely not a meal replacement on its own. I know it's not designed to be, obviously, but I did an experiment to see how well it would fill me up mixed with just water and drank on an empty stomach, and it didn't feel like much more than a granola bar would've done. Texture is smooth (added to water in a mason jar and shook to mix), taste is a pleasant vanilla, very sweet with a slight stevia/protein powder aftertaste, but not overwhelming. No troubles with digestive upset from having it on an empty stomach.

I like the list of vitamins and probiotics, which is why I decided to try it to help resolve some bloating issues, but it seems I'll have to use it mainly as a supplement or additive.

title: Tastes Good & Blends Well
body: My only complaint is that the container isn't as large as most protein powders you typical buy, but I am enjoying using this product in my daily smoothies. It blends very well and has a nice vanilla flavor (that's also not too sweet). I mix it with kale/spinach, and a variety of fresh and frozen fruits. So far, I have had NO GI upsets. I think this is going to be my go-to protein powder.

title: Don���t Mix with Water! Milk is WAY better! Add cinnamon!
body:
Mix with skim milk or a milk alternative low in sugar. I mixed it with water and it was nasty. Mixed with skim milk which was frothy and pretty tasty! I also added a dash of cinnamon! It does need to be in a blender bottle.

So far, no stomach issues to report after. It���s honestly like drinking a chocolate milk minus all of the sugar. Going to try and blend a banana in next time.

I have been using it to curb my snacking (my biggest issue) which seems to be helping but we will see. I will try and update this in a few weeks!

title: I like to smooth flavor
body: I like to smooth flavor, not too sweet, good meal replacement as you don't get hungry right away. Mixes well with fruits. Downside is when you add a fat like coconut oil or peanut butter the ice clumps up. I used to drink Shakeology and the flavor is more vanilla than ShakeO and good. Definitely ShakeO you get more vitamins but with this product you also get vitamins and then I take a pre-natal so its fine. Lastly, I just wish it was thicker, ShakeO is very thick and this isn't at all unless you use coconut milk or regular almond milk but over all, it compares very well when it comes to low sugars and good healthy carbs and vitamins. It is the closest and least expensive that I can find.

title: Good stuff all the way around
body: Good stuff all the way around, good taste, but also it goes with what you pick to put into it that makes it Great! I use vanilla yogurt and blueberry's, with a tad bit of milk and ice and mix it up, yummy. Digestively, has not let me down always feel good about being over bloated, meaning I'm not ever overloaded as long as I put this into my daily regimen... The reason for 4 stars is it seems to get old kinda of quick, the longer I had it I could actually taste it...It doesn't stay fresh in room temp for all that long, but I'm talking 3 months is when I started to notice the "old taste". But that just made me drink more quicker! LOL...So its all good, I would probably buy again due to the low price!

title: Tastes like real chocolate!
body: I've tried a few shake mixes/protein powders, and this is one of the better ones I've tried. A lot of the chocolate flavored mixes taste chalky and what I call "chocolate-adjacent"--you can tell they're TRYING to make it taste like chocolate, but they haven't quite got it right. Luckily, this one is rich and tastes like real chocolate. I mix it in with my breakfast smoothie or shake it up with some almond coconut milk for a quick snack. I know it's supposed to act as a sort of meal replacement, but it isn't quite filling enough for that. But I'll have it at breakfast with a banana and peanut butter and it does the trick! Also great to mix in with plain oatmeal for a little flavor!

title: Great taste
body:
Great tasting protein powder. I drink it with 8oz of milk and three or four ice cubes and blend it for 30 seconds for a milkshake sort of feel. Can���t get any better than that! I bought another chocolate plant based protein powder and ended up enjoying this one more because of the taste. Also it blends better than the other one. Highly recommend and for the price it���s great.

Also, I only use half the portion and it works well.

title: The vanilla is great! The chocolate not so much
body: I hate most protein powders. They usually have stevia which leaves an aftertaste or artificial sweeteners which I find just as disgusting. I���ve had both the vanilla and the chocolate, and despite loving all things chocolate, I���m a huge fan of this vanilla. The chocolate has stevia, and it���s not bad if you add a banana or some sugar to balance out the stevia, but it���s not great either. The vanilla leaves no weird taste during or after. My favorite way to make it is with half a banana, water and a splash of milk (tastes like cake batter!)but I���ve also mixed it with orange juice or with unsweetened cocoa powder,

title: Great tasting shake
body: This is a great tasting chocolate shake, not chalky at all as some can be. I initially bought it for the 1) good reviews from others 2) amount of vitamins 3) probiotics, 4) protein (15 grams), 5) low sugar (2 grams), and 6) low price. I use it as a snack/pick me up mid mornings or late afternoons. My daughter loves it too. I have mixed it with ice, banana, cinnamon, and/or peanut butter, but most of the time I just shake it with cold water and a few ice cubes. I have reordered it a few times already and plan to continue to reorder.

title: It tastes like dirt, but...
body: It's an acquired taste, really. It does taste like dirt (the choc flavor), but you get used to it after a few times. That's the only reason I knocked off a star, because all in all, it does the job. Just one serving keeps me full for a really long time, so it fulfills its purpose for me. I do wish we could get the container filled to the top with the powder, but it only comes filled to about half of the container, so you don't get ~a lot~ of product. However, you get what you pay for.

title: Taste leaves something to be desired
body: Love this protein powder even though I���ve had to play with getting the chocolate flavor to taste better. I found a cup or so of skim milk with a little water helps a lot. It���s filling and does the job I need it to do so I like it and continue to buy it. I just wish the chocolate tasted better without feeling like I need to add milk to get it to taste better.

title: Exactly what I needed.
body: I got this to aid in filling nutritional gaps in my diet since I don't eat enough. It's not the best tasting, definitely better if you use milk or milk alternative, but it blends well and isnt chalky. I use it in the morning in place of breakfast and in the evening with a small dinner and have noticed a difference in my energy level. It could be sweeter and taste more like chocolate but that's my only complaint. I've already recommended it to several friends and family members and will definitely be ordering again.

title: Almost 5 stars
body: The price is really great. Started just a little over $10, however I see recently went to over $17. Still a good price comparing to other brands. Flavor is always good, however I always order chocolate and 2 times they sent me vanilla. I would have given 5 stars had they sent me the correct flavor each time.

title: flavor hit or miss but does the job at a good price
body: I use this as my breakfast I use a blender and almond milk- I like using Shakeology but unfortunately the price tag is too steep for my budget - this one still keeps me going a few hours - I did not like the chocolate at all but the vanilla is a pretty decent flavor maybe a bit chalky on its own but I throw carrots and a banana typically in with it too and then it is not chalky at all.

title: Pretty good
body: The price was too good to pass up buying a protein shake. I mixed a scoop of the chocolate with my coffee and added a little bit of creamer. It was really good tasted like hot chocolate!

title: Good unless they send wrong flavor again
body: I have been drinking this as my breakfast for over a year. The chocolate tastes great and isn���t too sweet like other protein shakes I���ve had. My only issue is that twice now they have sent me vanilla when I ordered chocolate. The order and the sticker on top says chocolate but the container says vanilla. I don���t like the flavor.

title: This is my truth..
body: I bought this product to make sure I���m getting my daily vitamins, and as a morning meal replacement shake. What I like about this shake is it does keep me full longer then other shakes I���ve tried, it���s versatile so I can mix my shake with vegetables or fruits. I will say it can taste chalky (at least to me) when it���s just the shake mix with almond milk, that���s another reason I mix fruits with it in the morning. For the price you can���t beat it, I only drink it with fruit and it tastes great.

title: Formulated to meet the needs of today's health-conscious woman.
body:
Very tasty, I enjoy one at least daily and haven't gotten sick of them. Cheaper than the HMR shakes, but don't seem to be as good at appetite suppressing (I don't see anything in the description saying they would, so it's not a mark against them).

Wider variety of flavors would be nice, but vanilla/chocolate is pretty standard.

Little puzzled with the description of, "Nature's Bounty Optimal Solutions Complete Protein and Vitamin Shake Mix is formulated to meet the needs of today's health-conscious woman." <- I don't see anything on the bottle about it being for women... 2mg of iron isn't that bad, especially since I don't eat much read meat these days. I'd better switch to something else though, just to be safe. :P

title: Lots of benefits, not the best tasting
body: I like all of the benefits in this mixture. Taste wise, It���s not the worst shake I���ve had; definitely not the best. I found it very difficult to blend with almond milk (which is typically how I drink my shakes). I���ve been mixing it with water, which works better. I suggest mixing half a serving at a time to allow it to blend better, using both scoops before blending leaves the consistency extremely clumpy and hard to take.

title: Yummy
body: It doesn't taste funky if I don't drink all at once. Still good a couple hours later. Just shake it up and good. Keep refrigerated or load with ice.

title: I found a winner!
body: This is my favorite out all the protein powders I have tried. Comparable to shakeology without breaking my budget. I have vanilla I mix it with almond milk and fruit honey in a blender and it comes out tasting like heaven. The texture isn't gritty to me and after using it for about three weeks i notice a glow, my belly area a little tighten ( thanks to the collagen in it), and a sense of good health due to the vitamins and probiotics. I use this as a meal replacement once a day and it does hold me over for the next meal time. The ingredients are a short list and readable which equal little gunk a win in my book.

title: Great nutrition, so-so flavor from a non-vanilla lover
body:
Nutrition wise, it's great. Just look at that tag! Flavor, I have to disagree. Granted, vanilla is NOT a flavor I turn to. I simply chose it to be safe. This vanilla tastes more like vanilla pudding/cream/bean than say, vanilla ice cream and yogurt. The flavor is "thick" and not at all sweet. If that's what you want, cool.

I'm currently using extra flavoring for my taste's sake (or using it with almond milk + cereal), but I'll definitely get a different flavor next time. Edit: I'd like to add vanilla blends with flavors nicely. If you're not a vanilla lover, rest assured you can probably do whatever you want with it and it will work.

title: It gives you the metabolism you need to workout and get through the day.
body: I love the flavor. The chocolate is good too!

title: Quality product for the price
body: This is a great product for the low price. Natures Bounty is a good brand when it comes to health products. However, the taste and blending is not great but not bad either. All you need to do is add a fruit or a tablespoon of sugar to bump up the taste and all is well.

title: Not so good taste but curbs appetite
body:
I made this using two scoops like the container says and it was very strong and chalky. I had to drink water while drinking it. I made another one later in the day using one scoop. It was better but still not great. The good news is that when I went to eat dinner, I ate a few bites and was full. I never do That!
If you can get past the chalky flavor, it is great for appetite control.

title: Have Crohn's disease - tastes decent and doesn't upset my stomach
body: I bought this because I've been dragging lately and thought an extra boost wouldn't hurt. This shake doesn't have a lot of added bad stuff in it, is very reasonably priced, tastes good enough (I mix it with almond milk and ice) and doesn't upset my stomach which is a HUGE plus because I have Crohn's disease. Cuts down the need to take extra vitamins, amino acids and probiotics. It's too early to tell if it will help give me energy. I took off one star because I dislike stevia or any artificial sweetener and I think it compromises the taste but it is good enough. And definitely not gross or undrinkable as some reviewers said. I am very picky because of my stomach issues and because I am nauseous often.

title: Overall I think the value is great. It is very affordable and you get lots ...
body: Overall I think the value is great. It is very affordable and you get lots of vitamins. I mixed it with almond milk and some fruit and used it as a meal replacement, usually breakfast. The only downside is the taste. I have yet to try the chocolate but I will be soon. The vanilla has a vitamin smell and after taste that is tough to get used to. It does have somewhat of a chalky texture but not that bad. I bought Fitmiss (chocolate) and no after taste or chalky texture but I will definitely be trying the chocolate Nature's Bounty just to compare to FitMiss. They are both my go to meal supplements now.

title: Good taste
body: I am a male that supplements my meal replacement shakes with a little bit of this. The chocholate flavor of my current shakes was lacking a bit, but this helped immensely. I think the vanilla flavoring helps overall.

title: Good cocoa taste
body: I have no experience with Shakology, but this shake mix does taste good, very chocolaty, and isn't sweet. Like most chocolate shake mixes, it does not blend easily,. I don't use a blender, just give it a good long stir, but eventually it gets going. I use 1 scoop to 2 cups milk/banana/yogurt + PB powder, then add a bunch of sweetener. I freeze the shake, then defrost partially before eating. Yummy.

title: Good as an Add-On
body: The product was approximately 55% powder, 45% air. It comes with a little measuring scoop inside. You might have to sift through the contents a bit to find it. The flavor isn���t impressive, if you mix it only with water. Add it to your usual smoothie recipes, and it might add to the flavor a bit.

title: Delicious but I'm hungry 1h later
body:
I tried several protein shakes in these last 10 years. Basically all supermarket brands and some whole foods brands. This is definitely the best. I never had Almond milk and with this chocolate flavor, it was perfect. I use a shake mixer bottle.
It did not curb my appetite. Not even a bit.
I gained weight.
Right now I'm craving this shake as we speak.
I decided to mix only one spoon with the keto OS that tastes bad but curbs the appetite. So I used that one to reduce hunger and this one to taste good and add protein, probiotics, enzymes and vitamins.

title: Delicious!
body: This protein powder is delicious with some unsweetened almond milk! I really look forward to drinking it every day and I know I'm putting some vital nutrients in my body! The only reason it's not 5 stars is because it's slightly chalky when I attempt to blend it, but it's better than any other (and more expensive) brands I've tried in the past! I love the vanilla taste!

title: Great product, but...
body: I was so excited about this product. I had done a lot of research and value for the price couldn't be touched, IMO. The taste is plenty good, as protein shakes go. It's loaded with vitamins and other supplements, so I was able to discontinue several other supplements plus have a great dose of protein and use it as a meal replacement but I had just eliminated dairy from my diet and hadn't considered the whey in it. So I couldn't continue using it. More than that, I found that it greatly bloated me and was constipatng. I'm actually very disappointed because it was the best product I found for the price to replace a lot of supplements and provide and affordable meal replacement and protein, so now I'm back to the drawing board. There's a possibility that I could have worked with it more and made it work, but sadly I just don't feel great when I take it. I've been on one type of protein shake or the other for 20-30 years, so I was really excited about the content of this one for the price. I highly recommend it for that and the flavor. title: Just OK
body:
My main goal in using a meal replacement/nutritional supplement shake was to keep myself from getting to the point where I'm starving and end up binging on the nearest convenience food. I don't usually eat breakfast so I thought this could be a morning "meal" in the hopes that I would not be so hungry by lunchtime I hit the first drivethru I can find and order 6 of everything, or eat lunch at 10:30 and be dying by 2 pm. So far, it hasn't really worked, but I'm probably getting some vitamins and minerals that are lacking in my diet so I guess it's a wash. I don't know a whole lot about this kind of stuff, to be perfectly honest, so I'm not going to comment on it nutritionally. I looked at shakeology because a couple acquaintances are pushers but the cost of the stuff is unacceptable. In doing a little googling, there were a couple blogs that recommended this (among others) as a similar, yet cheaper, product. I decided to try the vanilla since I could play with the flavor more than with the chocolate.

Tastewise, it's ok. Vanilla flavor is mild but there. There is a significantly pronounced flavor of artificial sweeteners which I hate. I'd much prefer a less sweet product that I could sweeten to taste with something I actually like (raw honey, agave nectar, maple syrup, ANYTHING but artificial junk) or just not be as sweet.

Texturewise, it's ok. Little chalky but it could be a lot worse. The instructions are to mix 2 scoops with 8 oz of water. I found that to be too thick for my taste. For me, the sweet spot is right around 12-14 oz- that is about the consistency of chocolate milk. The powder does tend to cling to the edges and sides of the blender bottle so i find I need to stir/scrape with a table knife to loosen it before I shake it.

Generally speaking, it's just ok. There are a couple other products I'd like to try, but this one isn't bad. I will finish this tub before I order something else.

So far my preferred method has been to stir 2 scoops of powder into 10 oz of hot chai tea (black) and add enough ice to get up around the 14 oz mark and shake until the ice melts and the shake is cold. This gives me a mild iced chai latte kind of beverage that is actually pretty enjoyable.

title: Good protein shake, but read the label closely if you have sensitivities.
body:
I purchased this after trying a sample I'd received from the company. It has a very nice flavor and texture (I used it with almond milk) and It provided me with sufficient energy and hunger satiation until lunchtime.
My only real issue is that I had to start experiencing side effects to realize that the shake mix contains ingredients that I have sensitivities to but are not announced prominently on the label.
The label states that it is "suitable for vegetarians" but apparently that makes the assumption that vegetarians consume dairy/dairy products - which not all do and I absolutely do not. The only place it states that it contains dairy products is in fine print at the very bottom of the ingredients list. No mention of whey on the front label and even though it doesn't appear until about midway through the ingredients list, it was enough to disrupt my day after I'd been using it for about a week.

So overall, not at all a bad product -- definitely the tastiest shake I've encountered and it has a nice, smooth texture -- but if you're avoiding dairy based whey or need a true vegetarian/vegan option, I'd pass on this one.

I won't be purchasing this brand again in the future unless they release a new whey free formula. I'd personally recommend numedica (which is my usual - it is vegan, but rather pricey) or hemp protein (very effective, but some have slightly 'off' tastes, depending on the brand) if you're in the same boat as I am nutritionally.

title: Why does this never dissolve???
body:

And it's not a couple little pebbles; you can't just "smush" it because it just regroups. There's no point in even reading the nutrition facts because you're only getting like a tenth of it anyway, unless you "drink" mouthfuls of them. I'm so irritated with this facet of the product that any of the other benefits advertised still wouldn't get me to purchase it again.

It tastes STRONGLY of what I'm assuming is an artificial sweetener. Enough that I have to actively think about the fact that it's chocolate flavored to remember that's the taste I'm looking for. If you drink diet coke or the likes, this probably wouldn't be that much of a negative, but I hate it. I tried various methods to cover the taste and most things work if you put enough of it in. I have a mint cocoa that covers it well if you mix equal parts, peanut butter is pretty effective. Other chocolate decidedly doesn't do it, though. You can get it pretty tolerable, but I still haven't actually "finished" one because when you get to the bottom, it's just a layer or two of the pebbles described above; it's foul.

The benefits it boasts do sound like what I'm looking for. It's disappointing that it wasn't usable in practice.

title: Vanilla: great ingredients, good consistency, horrible taste.
body:
I really like the ingredient list. I like that it's all natural, and so much of it is organic. I love how packed it is with vitamins and supplements, though I do wish I knew what they were derived from.

I also like the consistency. Like most soy/whey drinks, this is a lot smoother than the vegan mixes. I did find that the recommended proportions were watery, and I had to either reduce water or increase the mix - but I know a lot of people mix up their shakes with other liquids or with additional ingredients, so that might not be an issue for everyone.

I can't stand the taste. I got the vanilla. The chocolate may be better, but I'm not willing to spend the money to find out.

First of all, it's sweetened entirely with stevia (unless you count the inulin, which I don't think contributes significantly). I don't mind some stevia, but this much leaves the distinctive non-sugar sweetness lingering in my mouth for an hour or more, which is not welcome. Secondly, regardless of the sweetener it's much too sweet. I know that's common with shakes, but some of them manage to avoid it and I wish this one had tried.

Thirdly, I don't understand how something with all-natural ingredients can taste so fake. I really like real vanilla, and I know this contains real vanilla, but it smells and tastes like the cheapest not-even-trying artificial flavoring imaginable.

I was looking for something soy and/or whey-based to mix with the 'lightly sweet' Garden of Life vegan mix because that's just a little too gritty for me by itself. I was using Lineavi, but I don't like that it contains artificial flavor (and yet tastes better than this does - go figure). I don't like wasting money, so I am grimly using this mix up doing that, and as long as I keep the ration to 50% or under, it's okay. Not great, but okay. When it's gone and I can justify buying a replacement, I'll be grateful.

title: Comparison review - Advocare, Nature's Bounty, Natures Way Reset
body:

It is grainy and you can 'taste' the protein/whey more than the others. Advocare is quite expensive per shake ($50 or so per 14 drinks), but I believe it tastes the best by a long shot. Natures Way has some really dumb packaging (it is a huge tub, but arrives half full once you open it) but is probably best cost/taste ratio in my opinion.

I'm assuming that all these shakes are fairly similar in content/effect, though that's obviously not the case - I just don't have enough nutritional background to make an intelligent comparison, but they all look similar in terms of protein content, calories per serving, minerals, vitamins, amino acids, etc.

title: Contains vitamin D2 not D3...
body:

I believe there is a reason why the "supplement facts" are buried behind the first 7 pictures of this item that come up without having to click the "+3". My fault for not doing more research also. My issue is vitamin D. There are two types: D2--Ergocalciferol and D3--Cholecalciferol. This product contains Ergocalciferol (D2). I know I can't link to any page here, however, it's easy to do the research to find many studies proving that D2 is far less effective than D3. The Vitamin D Council did an alarming study regarding the difference between D2 that doctors are/were prescribing and D3, which can be purchased over the counter. I don't like to write negative reviews for a few reasons, but in this case I don't want to see people hurt. I have to assume that some (including me prior to research) people look and see 200% RDA of vitamin D and believe they are covered.
Too bad though because I really like the taste of this product & the price. Even considering that the canister comes half full full of product.
